title: Revenue Accountant (part-time)
content:
We are a team. We are accountable. We partner with our clients to deliver strategic creative we are proud of.
We learn together, we create together, we win together.
And most importantly we have fun together.
 
About the Role
We're seeking a Revenue Accountant to join our team in Auckland.  This is a permanent part-time role at 20 hours per week.
As part of the role, you will partner closely with our Client Leaders and their teams to ensure their clients reach their revenue targets on a monthly basis. 
You will also ensure that clients are invoiced in accordance with client contractual obligations and help us to maintain integrity of Work in Progress.
 
Key Responsibilities
WIP Management

Continuous management and monitoring of WIP across all client portfolios ensuring all jobs are reconciled and are in line with client contracts
Ensure all costs incurred are invoiced to clients promptly
Ensure revenue recognition is accurate and in accordance with Agency policy, SOX policy and client contracts
Attend weekly / monthly meetings with the Group Account Directors, Account Managers and other key stakeholders regarding open job review, billing and re-forecasting
Monitor revenue; reconcile revenue to ensure forecasts are met, including actioning accruals and deferrals in an auditable manner if required; providing variance analysis between Forecast and Actual for Management
Coordination, preparation and processing of all Job Closes

Invoicing

Liaise with our client-facing team members regarding open jobs (refer above), to confirm amounts to be invoiced and recognised as revenue each month
Preparation of billing (invoice) pro-formas and liaising with key stakeholders for their review
Finalisation of invoices and issuing to clients
Maintain revenue working files

Production Billings 

Coordinate, printing and distribution of Job Cost Reports (JCR’s)
Review and reconciliation of JCR’s with Account Management and Production. This may involve one on one meetings to discuss and action JCR issues
Process and action all JCR’s for monthly Production Billings and ensuring Debit Balance WIP is kept to a minimum
Ensure JCRs are returned in a timely manner
Invoice Production with the right client PO quoted on the invoice where applicable
Coordinate and print all necessary month end Production Billings reports i.e. Estimate Reports, Credit Note Summary, Invoice Summary

Inter-company billings

Monitor intercompany arrangements (e.g. intercompany invoicing for Talent and other items), and that costs and revenue are correctly recorded on jobs
Liaise with Group Account Directors, and Job / Account Managers regarding intercompany arrangements and confirmation of amounts to be paid / charged to intercompany counterparts on a monthly basis
Issue intercompany invoices by 20th of the month with all supporting documents attached.
Coordinate and follow up on invoices in the event of invoice dispute

Client reporting

Preparation of Client specific reports as requested and ensuring that they are correct, eg. Retainer reconciliation, where required
Monitor unreleased estimate status
Monitor WIP balances
Review cost estimates to ensure compliance with client contracts
Attend weekly client work in progress meetings
Understanding Client contract specifics and ensuring these are adhered to through the production billings process

Training and business support

Systems and process training of new starters and refresher courses for existing staff where required
Work closely with Account Management teams and promptly addressing any queries

 
Required skills and experience

Ability to work independently as a committed member of the Finance team
Approachable and confident approaching others
Proactive
Ability to work to deadlines
Attention to detail
Practice professionalism at all times
Ability to work independently as a committed member of the Finance team
 Approachable and confident approaching others
Proactive
Ability to work to deadlines
Attention to detail
Practice professionalism at all times
Previous experience in a billing’s role
BCC Enterprise experience (preferred but not essential)
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office programs
Strong Excel skills
Strong communications skills 

 
At Ogilvy you will live the agency values and behaviours on a daily basis – Collaboration, Playfulness, Excellence, Courage and Curiosity.
"When people are having fun, they produce better work” – David Ogilvy, Founder.
 
Please note: All applicants must have valid New Zealand working rights.
Ogilvy New Zealand is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply.
Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide here: https://bit.ly/secrets-keptAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
